subject: Art & Design
title: Google Fonts: Democratizing Typography
description: A short lesson to help you apply Google Fonts: Democratizing Typography.

hook.text: Before Google Fonts, custom web typography cost hundreds of dollars per year. Google made it free.

buildup.text: Launched in 2010, Google Fonts hosts 1,500+ open-source typefaces used by millions of websites.

discovery.text: Roboto, Open Sans, Lato, and Montserrat â€” the most-used fonts on the web all live on Google Fonts.

twist.text: Free fonts leveled the playing field, but also homogenized the web. Many sites now look typographically identical.

climax.text: Variable font support, multilingual coverage, and CDN delivery make it a complete typographic infrastructure.

punchline.text: Google Fonts didn't just free typography. It made the web literate.

quiz.question: What unintended consequence did free web fonts create?
